document.docTitle: Leucophenga longipenis Huang & Chen, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VI: the argentata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VI: the argentata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species differs from the other Asian species of the
argentata
group by having the mesonotum mostly brownish in male ( Fig. 4 C) and entirely brownish yellow in female ( Fig. 4 E), and the aedeagus dorsolaterally with an acute process and distolaterally with a thin process ( Fig. 9 D).

Description. Ocellar triangle brownish, with ca. 2–4 setae above ocellar setae. Frons yellow in male, yellowish to brownish yellow in female. Pedicel yellowish in male, yellow in female; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus brownish yellow. Palpus brownish yellow. Postpronotal lobe yellowish in male ( Fig. 4 D), yellow in female ( Fig. 4 F). Acrostichal setulae in ca. 8–10 irregular rows ( Fig. 4 C, E). Scutellum brown, dark brown laterally and yellowish at tip in male ( Fig. 4 C), brownish yellow, dark brown laterally and yellow at tip in female ( Fig. 4 E). Pleura, katepisternum and meron yellow to yellowish ( Fig. 4 D, F). Wing ( Fig. 2 D): Costal vein between R2+3 and R4+5 distally with ca. 4–7 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. All abdominal tergites with brown to black patches in both male and female ( Fig. 5 J–L). Male terminalia: Epandrium pubescent medially and near posterior margin, with ca. 5 setae near posterior margin and ventral corner per side ( Fig. 9 A). Paramere triangular, narrowed apically, with ca. 2 sensilla submedially ( Fig. 9 C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Leucophenga longipenis
sp. nov.
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods and aedeagus; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus, acute process (ap) and thin process (tp). Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

Distribution. China ( Zhejiang , Hunan , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Yunnan , Xizang ).
Etymology. A combination of the Latin words “ longus ” (= long) + “ penis ” (= aedeagus), referring to the aedeagus slender.
